name: Stronger Together (Tim David)
description:
NOTE:

So I accidentally forgot to turn back on the trigger that lets you go to the next level upon breaking an object, which I had off for debugging, so you can only play like, most of the tutorial before you get soft-locked. I know I'm not permitted to edit the game after the jam has officially ended but I wanted to upload a fixed version in-case anyone still wants to play it, so here it is! (about 45 minutes after the deadline, just like my assignments at uni) https://tim-david.itch.io/stronger-together-but-with-1-bug-fix-that-makes-it-actually-playable

CW: Swearing

This game is honestly a bit of a mess.

I over scoped and didn't leave enough time to finish the latter half of the game properly so it's very rushed and stuffed in there at the last minute, but I hope you will still enjoy what you can of it either way :)

How I used the theme:

The theme was "take care" so I wanted to make a game about 2 characters taking care of each other. In "stronger together" one character can fight, the other can platform better, so they need each other to succeed. 

EDIT: Fortunately with 3 minutes remaining I remembered too turn off my debug markers, but had to upload a 2nd build, feel free to give the original version I uploaded to see some behind the scenes stuff lol.

Controls: (Also shown in game)

A - D to Move

Space to Jump

Tab to Warp

Shift to Swap

Click to Attack

Alt + F4 to quit
